title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.2: COMMUNITY BASED PROTECTIVEENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2024, Community child-protection practices are strengthened to prevent and respond to violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation. , which contributes to Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, Community child-protection practices are strengthened to prevent and respond to violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation.

description.narrative: Overall, data on identification, referral and service provision show how the expansion of the pool and capacities of social service workforce, combined with better and more systematic use of social contracts and attestation of indigence have led to increase capacities to effectively assist children in situation of vulnerability.In 2021, 452,072 children (185,000 more than in 2020) in need were identified by social workers and community actors and;referred to appropriate social services. 2,398,923 community members were sensitized on birth registration across the country via radio, face to face awareness raising, and other forms of community engagement;including in schools and health facilities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2021
